Race.SpecificTitle: PW PJ (Vet.)   Prop. #1 -- Disabled Vet. Homestead Exemp.- PJ
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Propositions
Proposition No. 1
(Disabled Veterans Homestead Exemption)

Summary:  Authorizes an additional homestead exemption in the Parish of Caldwell, State of Louisiana, for certain disabled veterans and surviving spouses in accordance with and subject to the provisions of Article VII, Section 21(K) of the Louisiana Constitution.
Race.FullText: Shall an additional homestead exemption be authorized in the Parish of Caldwell, State of Louisiana, for certain disabled veterans and surviving spouses in accordance with and subject to the provisions of Article VII, Section 21(K) of the Louisiana Constitution, provided that this additional homestead exemption shall extend and apply to property in Caldwell Parish only after approval by a majority of the registered voters of Caldwell Parish voting on this proposition?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW Police Jury Prop. #2 -- 2.18 Mills - PJ - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Propositions
Proposition No. 2
(Tax Continuation)

Summary:  10 year, 2.18 mills property tax continuation for the purpose of (i) funding a reserve of $50,000 for industrial operations and maintenance and job inducement at the Caldwell Parish Industrial Park and (ii) the remainder of the proceeds of the tax to be used for the purpose of improving, maintaining and operating the 911 emergency telephone system in the Parish, including the acquisition and maintenance of the necessary facilities and equipment therefor.
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of Caldwell, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), levy a two and eighteen hundredths (2.18) mills tax on all the property subject to taxation in the Parish (an estimated $95,920 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2011 and ending with the year 2020, for the purpose of (i) funding a reserve of $50,000 for industrial operations and maintenance and job inducement at the Caldwell Parish Industrial Park and (ii) the remainder of the proceeds of the Tax to be used for the purpose of improving, maintaining and operating the 911 emergency telephone system in the Parish, including the acquisition and maintenance of the necessary facilities and equipment therefor, said millage to represent a twelve hundredths of a mill (.12) increase over the 2.06 mills tax authorized to be levied through the year 2010 pursuant to an election held on January 20, 2001?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW Police Jury Prop. #3 -- 3.29 Mills - PJ - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Propositions
Proposition No. 3
(Tax Continuation)

Summary:  10 year, 3.29 mills property tax continuation for maintaining and operating the Caldwell Parish Courthouse and Jail.
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of Caldwell, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), levy a three and twenty-nine hundredths (3.29) mills tax on all the property subject to taxation in the Parish (an estimated $144,760 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2011 and ending with the year 2020, for the purpose of maintaining and operating the Caldwell Parish Courthouse and Jail, said millage to represent an eighteen hundredths of a mill (.18) increase over the 3.11 mills tax authorized to be levied through the year 2010 pursuant to an election held on January 20, 2001?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW Police Jury Prop. #4 -- 7.13 Mills - PJ - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Propositions
Proposition No. 4
(Library Millage Continuation)

Summary:  10 year, 7.13 mills tax continuation for the purpose of equipping, improving, operating, maintaining and supporting the Caldwell Parish Library.
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of Caldwell, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), continue to levy a special tax of seven and thirteen hundredths (7.13) mills on all the property subject to taxation in the Parish (an estimated $313,500 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2012 and ending with the year 2021, for the purpose of equipping, improving, operating, maintaining and supporting the Caldwell Parish Library, said millage to represent a forty hundredths of a mill (.40) increase over the 6.73 mills tax authorized to be levied through the year 2011 pursuant to an election held on October 20, 2001?
